citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The itinerary submitted to the Fort Collins, CO office for this season did not include the name, identification number,
description, sex, and age for the 10 wolf hybrids currently traveling overnight away from the home site. The itinerary must
include complete and accurate information for any animal used for exhibition at any location other that the approved home
site. Failure to provide this information makes it difficult to track animals away from the home site. Licensee must update
itinerary to include this information and submit it to the Fort Collins, CO office. APHIS form 7010 was left with licensee
during this inspection to help submit an updated itinerary. Correct by September 14, 2023.

The facility did have a documented contingency plan available for inspection. If an emergency or natural disaster were to
occur at the facility or on the road while traveling, the lack of a written contingency plan could impact animal health and
welfare, if the licensee or employees were not prepared to respond to the situation appropriately. Exhibitors must develop,
document, and follow an appropriate contingency plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation,
housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. APHIS form 7093 was left with licensee
during this inspection to help complete a contingency plan. Correct by September 28, 2023.

The written program of veterinary care (PVC) available during this inspection was last signed by the attending veterinarian
on 5/17/2019. The current veterinary care program (APHIS form 7002) is not complete. This PVC does not address the
sampling for worms, coccidia, giardia, or heartworm with a schedule approved by the attending veterinarian. There was
no documentation of any of the wolf hybrids receiving a head to tail physical examination by the attending veterinarian
within the last 12 months, nor were there records of vaccinations for the wolf hybrids. APHIS form 7002A was provided to
licensee during this inspection to help update the written program of veterinary care. Licensee must contact the attending
veterinarian and have the PVC updated to include a yearly physical and a schedule for sampling and treatment of
parasites and other pests. In addition records of vaccinations including rabies, parvovirus, and distemper must be
maintained to ensure adequate veterinary care is provided to the wolf hybrids. Correct by September 28, 2023.

citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs and cats.
citations.narrative:
The primary enclosure housing the 5 British Columbian wolf hybrids had a loose wire panel on the floor that came off the
air conditioning vent. There was also protruding wire points on the aluminum wire panel for the shift door. Primary
enclosures must be maintained in good repair to prevent injury to the animals and to contained them securely. Correct by
repairing and maintaining enclosures in good repair. Correct by September 28, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
